channel.title: If you got a key, then the door opens
channel.description:
Hi... I want this but idk how to do it :L
if (you got key) { Open door or pass though, and close after so new people have to get the key too. (only 1 player each time, or just a small teleport so that the door doenst open) destroy key
can someone help please ^^?

item.title: If you got a key, then the door opens
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:12, topic:535293”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=654096.msg4381758#msg4381758 date=1383784033]

Why would you check where the player is if you can check where the object is.

He may want a one-way door to avoid players being trapped on the other side.

Still, why can’t you check the doors location, then the players based on the doors location?

if(doorX == here && doorY == here){ if(playerX == here && playerY == here) movethatbitch(x, y,z); else sendMessage("Yo, move near the door."); }

It’s fairly redundant. If they’re using a door and they’re in a certain location then it’s highly unlikely that there will be more than one door in any of the adjacent tiles - there’s no need to check the door’s location and the player’s location when the player’s location will give the information needed.

I honestly usually just use object position checks in the server, unless it’s going to be a two way door, because by default PI’s object offset is 1 tile, meaning you can’t be more than 1 tile away from the door to use it.
[/quote]

Most locked doors in RuneScape are one-way locks though, IIRC, so that players can’t get locked inside a building and never get out. That’s why I suggested checking the player’s position so that if they are on one side of the door then they need a key, if they are on the other side then they don’t need a key. Remember that this is how it works in real life with doors that don’t use a bolt lock.[/quote]

In irl you don’t drop your key every time you open a door though. lol
Anyways on most doors in RS map, they are designed to swing into the house(building), as in real life. So in reality you could use the ID of a door, relative to the face direction, to tell them what position they should be moved too.

[code]####################################

@ @ @@ @ @ @@@@

@ @ @ @ @ @ @ @

@@@@ @ @ @ @ @@

@ @ @ @ @ @ @

@ @ @@ @ @ @@@@

####################################

| | |

| | |

#||_____|____#

| ====== |

| = = |

| = = |

#|=@ =|____#

| = = |

| = = |

| = = |

#|======__|#

	   ->
	  /	
	 ^ [/code]

Read full topic
item.source: If you got a key, then the door opens

item.title: If you got a key, then the door opens
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:535293”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=654096.msg4381756#msg4381756 date=1383783833]

Why would you check where the player is if you can check where the object is.

He may want a one-way door to avoid players being trapped on the other side.

Still, why can’t you check the doors location, then the players based on the doors location?

if(doorX == here && doorY == here){ if(playerX == here && playerY == here) movethatbitch(x, y,z); else sendMessage("Yo, move near the door."); }

It’s fairly redundant. If they’re using a door and they’re in a certain location then it’s highly unlikely that there will be more than one door in any of the adjacent tiles - there’s no need to check the door’s location and the player’s location when the player’s location will give the information needed.
[/quote]

I honestly usually just use object position checks in the server, unless it’s going to be a two way door, because by default PI’s object offset is 1 tile, meaning you can’t be more than 1 tile away from the door to use it.[/quote]

Most locked doors in RuneScape are one-way locks though, IIRC, so that players can’t get locked inside a building and never get out. That’s why I suggested checking the player’s position so that if they are on one side of the door then they need a key, if they are on the other side then they don’t need a key. Remember that this is how it works in real life with doors that don’t use a bolt lock.

Read full topic

if(doorX == here && doorY == here){ if(playerX == here && playerY == here) movethatbitch(x, y,z); else sendMessage("Yo, move near the door."); }

If they’re using a door and they’re in a certain location then it’s highly unlikely that there will be more than one door in any of the adjacent tiles - there’s no need to check the door’s location and the player’s location when the player’s location will give the information needed.[/quote]

I honestly usually just use object position checks in the server, unless it’s going to be a two way door, because by default PI’s object offset is 1 tile, meaning you can’t be more than 1 tile away from the door to use it.

item.title: If you got a key, then the door opens
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:4, topic:535293”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=654096.msg4381622#msg4381622 date=1383749148]
This is PI code:

case 1234://Door ID in first click object
if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(666, 1){//Key ID, amount
c.getPA().movePlayer(X, Y, Z);//Cheap hax to go 'through' the door. Making it so all players must have the key.
}
break;

Ignore conventions, it was typed in the reply box.
[/quote]

Why do you always use PI for your examples?[/quote]
Maybe, just MAYBE, it’s the main source I work with. But I could be wrong jokes

[quote=“Ambokile, post:8, topic:535293”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=654096.msg4381658#msg4381658 date=1383756603]

I got a pi so its no problem for me

EDIT:
1 more question…
What if you have like 4 doors with the same id, how to make them “different”, because the case is the same.

Check the player’s location, see which door they are at.

Why would you check where the player is if you can check where the object is.
[/quote]

He may want a one-way door to avoid players being trapped on the other side.[/quote]
Still, why can’t you check the doors location, then the players based on the doors location?

if(doorX == here && doorY == here){ if(playerX == here && playerY == here) movethatbitch(x, y,z); else sendMessage("Yo, move near the door."); }

Read full topic
